name: HD 24064
scenarioDescription:
The HD 24064 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 24064 is a star with 1.61 times the mass of the Sun, and 40 times its radius. It is located 987.80 light years away from the solar system.

HD 24064 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 24064 system


HD 24064 b

HD 24064 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 24064 b is 4099.02 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 24064 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 24064, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
